target_markets.market_description: Scientists working in primary research and technology commercialization
pain_points: difficulty translating scientific discoveries into market applications
gap between research and commercial viability
target_markets.market_size_indicators: Technology commercialization and biotech sectors with DNA sequencing as example market

problems_validated.problem: Scientists focused on primary research struggle to see non-linear market applications of their discoveries
problems_validated.severity: High - prevents valuable technology from reaching market
problems_validated.current_solutions: Traditional linear approach from discovery to obvious application
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of understanding of markets and ability to connect multiple points of view to form novel business concepts

products_tools.name: DNA sequencing technology
products_tools.use_case: High-throughput, cheap DNA sequencing using optical scanning technology
products_tools.pricing: mentioned as 'super cheap' compared to previous methods

business_strategies.strategy: Connect the dots between science, markets, and people to identify non-linear applications
business_strategies.implementation: Look beyond obvious applications, understand market needs, combine multiple perspectives
business_strategies.expected_results: Create novel business concepts that can transform markets
business_strategies.case_study: Optical scanning technology evolution into DNA sequencing - non-obvious application that created significant value

problems_solutions.problem: Technology commercialization requires seeing non-linear connections between discoveries and market applications
problems_solutions.solution: Connect dots between science, markets, and people rather than following linear path from discovery to obvious application
steps: Understand what markets are telling us
Analyze what science shows us about possibilities
Identify people who can execute novel point of view

startup_ideas.idea: Technology commercialization consulting connecting scientific discoveries to non-obvious market applications
startup_ideas.target_market: Research institutions, scientists, early-stage tech companies
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Bridge between scientific discovery and market application
startup_ideas.business_model: Consulting and potentially equity participation in commercialized technologies
startup_ideas.validation: Success of non-linear applications like optical scanning to DNA sequencing

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Following linear thinking from scientific discovery to obvious application
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Missing the most valuable and transformative market opportunities
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Look for non-linear connections and understand markets deeply
mistakes_to_avoid.example: If optical scanning developers only thought about obvious imaging applications, DNA sequencing breakthrough wouldn't have happened

trends_signals.trend: Non-linear technology applications creating the most value
trends_signals.opportunity: Identifying technologies with potential for unexpected applications before others see the connection

actionable_quotes.quote: our job is to connect the dots connect the dots between science markets and people
actionable_quotes.actionability: Framework for evaluating technology opportunities by examining science, market needs, and execution capability

actionable_quotes.quote: the most value can be created by seeing maybe a few steps ahead of where the confluence or the non-linearity arises
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining where maximum value creation occurs in technology
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on identifying convergence points and non-linear applications before they become obvious

actionable_quotes.quote: if it were very linear everyone would do it right
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining why non-linear thinking is necessary for breakthrough innovation
actionable_quotes.actionability: Seek non-obvious connections and applications rather than following conventional paths

meta.title: How Novel Ideas Are Created with David Friedberg | Where It Happens Podcast
